intro: Maytenus longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf mayten, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a dense, rounded crown. The leaves are alternate, simple, and elliptic, with a smooth margin and a glossy dark green upper surface. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellowish flowers followed by small, orange-red berries. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions.
